page.title: 13RELIGION
page.content: Our area has two places of worship, both situated in the village of Clipston. The Baptist Chapel and All Saints Church. Services were first held on the site of the Baptist Chapel in 1752. It is the highest point in the village. The original Chapel was built in 1778. The present building was erected in 1803. In the early years people came from all the surrounding villages to worship in the way they wanted. It was called free prayer. The Chapel people thought that it was the spirit of fellowship to stay for the whole day and thoroughly enjoy themselves. It was their weekly day out. The congregation at this time was made up of mainly tradesmen and their families. The richer classes tended to go to their local Parish Churches. Competition arose between the two types of worship.
